Viaf cluster heading merged from record 000160486

Shimon Peres (Shimon Peres was born Szymon Perski, on 2 August 1923, Wiszniew, Poland (now Vishnyeva, Belarus), to Yitzhak (1896–1962) and Sara (1905–1969 née Meltzer) Perski. Shimon Peres (About this sound listen (help·info); Hebrew: שמעון פרס; born Szymon Perski; 2 August 1923) is a Polish-born Israeli statesman. The family spoke Hebrew, Yiddish and Russian at home, and Peres learned Polish at school. He now speaks English and French in addition to Hebrew. He was the ninth President of Israel from 2007 to 2014. Peres served twice as the Prime Minister of Israel and twice as Interim Prime Minister, and he was a member of 12 cabinets in a political career spanning over 66 years.[1] Peres was elected to the Knesset in November 1959 and, except for a three-month-long hiatus in early 2006, served continuously until 2007, when he became President.)

(Kishon River or Qishon River, intermittent stream, NW Israel, rises in Mt. Giboa E. of Jenin, near Jordan Border, flows 45 mi. in winding course generally NW through Plain of Jezreel, then along NE slope of Mt. Carmel, to Bay of Acre of Mediterranean at Haifa. Connected with biblical stories of Sisera and Eliza; in Bible also called Kison)
